rComments: Jim Wells hasn't published anything relevant since the early 90s. He is past his expiration date. One wonders why the university keeps him on a payroll. He is a terrible lecturer and an actual psychopath. The few positive reviews about him on this page need not be trusted; they're from similar psychopaths.
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Lecture heavy', 'Tough grader']

rComments: He said I should consider a career in molecular pharmacology after dissing me in an email stating "one wonders what happened to you during the school year". You need a strategy when tackling his exams - everything is a game to him and requires meticulous amount of effort to achieve a decent mark. You won't be the same person leaving this course.
teacherRatingTags: ['Tough grader', 'Get ready to read', 'Lots of homework']

rComments: The greatest professor I've had. Jim Wells teaches all the foundational knowledge needed to excel in his course and requires you to go beyond these basic concepts and think, rather than regurgitate facts/lists. I can see how some students dislike him because of his condescending nature but stupid questions deserve this. Sad day when Wells retires.
I have no respect for this person, because he never earned it in the first place. Very rude to students. Inpatient towards questions.

there is nothing good to say about this teacher. Wells need to understand that in 2017 material he teaches could be updated from 1990s when the course was taught.  No office hours, no help to students during class, dismisses questions, and only replies emails to brush the questions off with big words. Useless course.

He is an old man who needs to retire. He does not understand that he needs to make changes in his way of teaching. He presents material from ancient days when he was born and is unaccepting to knew knowledge in the field. He has bad attitude towards students and disrespects them.

Unfortunately most people who take his course, have to, and do not have any other option. He is  one of the most unapproachable individuals I have met in my academic career. He makes fun of thing he feels are unimportant, he makes fun of students who ask questions in class. He does not repeat anything twice. Inhuman, rude & no compassion.

This is by far the worst course I have ever taken in my 6 years of university study. The prof is extremely condescending, unhelpful, and his notes are both outdated and useless. Take this course extremely seriously, and get help EARLY. This is coming from an 'A' student. Study HARD, and best of luck.

Gives a handout package the size of a phonebook when he barely spends more than 5 seconds on most of the pages.  90% of the stuff in there you can find yourself in online journals.  Concepts are not explained clearly at all.

Lets just say you will learn MORE from the past exam solutions (and much faster) then you will ever learn from attending his lectures. Take my advice get the upper year solutions/notes and never attend his classes - they're useless.

Way too much material, uses outdated experiments that are no longer relevant, singles you out if you ask a quesiton in class, doesn't cover general concepts well, just flies through experiments and evidence that we're supposed to make sense of.  At least he gives a lot of bonus marks on the exam because otherwise 90% of the class would fail.

Not only is he unbelievably hard to follow through his phonebook sized book of unexplained graphs and primary source examples, he also refuses to simply explain concepts.  It's also criminal that he wastes almost 60000 pieces of paper per year with single sided notes.

Wells is my favourite prof.  It's amazing how he can teach you so many pages of med chem which don't have much description on the course notes, but when you study for a test and made good notes, it all starts to make much more sense.  He's good at teaching dose-response curves in the biochem course too.  His jokes about homeopathy are funny.
How do you consider 300 pages of 3D molecular structures, graphs and DNA sequences notes???

Acourse filled with booklets of info, none of it particularly useful or the slightest bit interesting. However, wells section is by far the worst filled with graphs from outdated exepriments, and no explanations.Not to mention the cummulative exam!

Incredibly hard material. Quite dry. He is clear and will answer your questions but don't expect to slide through his section of the course. A lot of people study other parts of the course and skip his section of the exam.
